Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Step 1: Data Analysis - Calculate Case Durations I need to calculate the time taken from the Submit Claim event to the Close Claim event for each case. Case 2001: Submit: 2024-04-01 09:00 Close: 2024-04-01 10:30 Duration: 1 hour 30 minutes (1h 30m) or 90 minutes. Case 2002: Submit: 2024-04-01 09:05 Close: 2024-04-02 11:00 Duration: Day 1: 09:05 to 24:00 = ~14h 55m Day 2: 00:00 to 11:00 = 11h 00m Total: 25h 55m. Case 2003: Submit: 2024-04-01 09:10 Close: 2024-04-03 09:30 Duration: 09:10 -> 00:00 (April 1) = 14h 50m. April 2 00:00 -> April 3 09:30 = 33h 30m. Total = 48h 20m. Case 2004: Submit: 2024-04-01 09:20 Close: 2024-04-01 10:45 Duration: 1 hour 25 minutes. Case 2005: Submit: 2024-04-01 09:25 Close: 2024-04-04 14:30 Duration: 09:25 -> 00:00 (Day 1) = ~14h 35m. Day 2 00:00 -> Day 4 14:30 = 2 days, 14h 30m. Total: 3 days, 5h 05m.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Step 2: Identify Cases with Performance Issues Comparing durations: 2001: ~1.5 hours (Efficient) 2004: ~1.4 hours (Efficient) 2002: ~26 hours (Very slow - almost 1.5 days, ~1 day difference from 2004) 2003: ~48 hours (Extremely slow - ~2 days, ~2 days difference from 2004) 2005: ~77 hours (Exceptionally slow - >3 days) Performance Issues (Performance Bottlenecks): Case 2002: Longest among medium/low, almost double 2001/2004. Case 2003: High complexity, very long. Case 2005: High complexity, longest of all, highest count of Request Additional Documents.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Step 3: Analyze Attributes and Root Causes Group 1: Low Complexity (Cases 2001, 2004) Region A (2001) vs Region B (2004). 2001 (Region A): 90 mins. Efficient. 2004 (Region B): 85 mins. Efficient. Insight: Region A is slightly faster for Low Complexity, but both are fast. Complexity seems to be the primary driver, as these are the quickest cases. Group 2: Medium Complexity (Case 2002) Region B. Insight: The Request Additional Documents activity is the biggest delay here. It happened at 14:00, which is 4 hours after the previous step (9:45). Then a gap of 20 hours (4/1 14:00 to 4/2 10:00) before Approve.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Group 3: High Complexity (Cases 2003, 2005) Region A (2003) vs Region B (2005). Region B (2005) is much worse than Region A (2003). Case 2003: 3 instances of Request Additional Documents. Request 1: 11:00 -> Request 2: 17:00 (6 hours gap). Case 2005: 3 instances of Request Additional Documents by same Adjuster (Adjuster_Lisa). Insight: High complexity claims definitely generate follow-ups. However, the time between requests in Case 2005 (21 hours) is excessive.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Attribute Correlation Analysis: 1. Complexity: Low Complexity (2001, 2004): < 1.5 hours. Medium Complexity (2002): ~26 hours. High Complexity (2003, 2005): > 48 hours. Root Cause: Higher complexity leads to more back-and-forth (multiple document requests) and longer processing times. 2. Region: Region A (2001, 2003): 2001 is fast. 2003 is slow. Region B (2002, 2004, 2005): 2004 is fast. 2002 and 2005 are slow. Hypothesis: Does Region B have specific bottlenecks?

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: 3. Resource: Case 2002 (Region B, Medium): Adjuster_Lisa handled the Request Document delay (4h gap). Case 2005 (Region B, High): Adjuster_Lisa handled the documents (AND did all three). Recurring Resource: Adjuster_Lisa (Case 2002 & 2005). Observation: Adjuster_Lisa seems to be the bottleneck.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Step 4: Synthesize Root Causes and Mitigations Root Causes: 1. High Complexity Claims: Obvious root cause. They require more documents. 2. Resource/Bottleneck (Adjuster_Lisa): In Case 2002, there is a 4-hour gap... In Case 2005, she handles multiple document requests... Refining the Resource Analysis: Why is Adjuster_Lisa slow? Case 2004 (Low Complexity): Fast with Adjuster_Lisa. Case 2002 (Medium): Slow with Adjuster_Lisa. Case 2005 (High): Slowest with Adjuster_Lisa. Lets double check the timestamps for 2005 again... Conclusion: Adjuster_Lisa is the primary resource bottleneck.

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: One more check on Case 2002: Submit 09:05. Request 14:00. Approve 10:00 (next day). Case 2004: Submit 09:20. Approve 10:00... Final plan looks solid.
